required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Post Marketing Surveillance on Lutathera® in Patients With Somatostatin Receptor Positive Gastroenteropancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor in Korea
clinical_study.official_title: A Post Marketing Surveillance on Lutathera® (Lutetium (177Lu) Oxodotreotide, 177Lu-DOTA0-Tyr3-Octreotate) in Patients With Somatostatin Receptor Positive Gastroenteropancreatic Neuroendocrine Tumor (GEP-NET) in Korea

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective, open-label, multi-center, non-comparative, non-interventional observational study to assess safety and effectiveness of Lutathera in patients with somatostatin receptor-positive GEP-NET in the real-world setting in Korea.

primary_outcome.description: Incidence of Adverse Events (AEs), Serious AE and unexpected AEs.
Incidence of Adverse Drug Reactions (ADRs), Serious ADRs and unexpected ADRs.

secondary_outcome.measure: Effectiveness in terms of Overall Response Rate (ORR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 32 weeks (4 cycles of 8 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: ORR is defined as the proportion of treated patients who achieve a best overall response of partial response (PR) or complete response (CR) according to RECIST 1.1. Partial Response (PR): At least a 30% decrease from baseline, confirmed at 4 weeks. Complete Response (CR): Disappearance of all known disease, confirmed at 4 weeks, lymph nodes must be less than 10 mm short axis

intervention.description: Prospective observational study. There is no treatment allocation. Patients administered Lutathera by prescription that have started before inclusion of the patient into the study will be enrolled.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with somatostatin receptor-positive GEP-NET in the real-world setting in Korea.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patients who start Lutathera treatment per clinical judgment, according to the locally approved labeling.
- somatostatin receptor-positive gastroenteropancreatic neuroendocrine tumors (GEP-NETs) in adults.
2. Patients who are willing to provide written informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patients with contraindication according to prescribing information for Lutathera in Korea.
